findings.content: Height: 160 cm, Weight: 70 kg, BMI: 27.3 (Overweight). Temperature: 36.9°C (98.4°F), Pulse: 82/min, Blood Pressure: 135/85 mm Hg.

Vital Signs.interpretation: Vital signs indicate stable overall condition, with BMI suggesting overweight status.

Skin Examination.purpose: Evaluate skin lesions and surrounding tissue

content.content: Violaceous (purple-red) retiform patches with ulceration and black eschar. Surrounding induration and tenderness.

content.caption: Retiform patches on the lower leg.

Skin Examination.interpretation: Findings consistent with necrotic ulcers indicative of calciphylaxis.

Systemic Examination.purpose: Assess for systemic involvements or complications

findings.content: No signs of systemic inflammation, such as fever or lymphadenopathy.

Systemic Examination.interpretation: Absence of systemic inflammatory signs reduces suspicion for systemic infection.

Serum Calcium and Phosphate Levels.purpose: Determine calcium and phosphate levels to assess metabolic status
Serum Calcium and Phosphate Levels.interpretation: Elevated calcium and phosphate levels indicate likely calciphylaxis due to CKD.

Parathyroid Hormone (PTH).purpose: Evaluate PTH levels in the context of chronic kidney disease

results.content: PTH Level: 150 pg/mL (Reference Range: 10-65 pg/mL, HIGH)

Parathyroid Hormone (PTH).interpretation: Elevated PTH levels due to secondary hyperparathyroidism in CKD.

Skin Biopsy.purpose: Assess tissue for ischemic changes and calcium deposits

content.content: Microscopic examination shows ischemic vascular changes with necrosis and calcium deposition in small vessels.

content.caption: Evidence of ischemia and calcium deposits in microvasculature.

Skin Biopsy.interpretation: Biopsy findings are indicative of calciphylaxis.

results.content: Positive staining for calcium deposits in vascular tissue.

Special Staining.interpretation: Confirms the presence of calcification in blood vessels, supporting diagnosis.

results.content: X-rays show evidence of subcutaneous calcifications consistent with advanced calciphylaxis.
